intro: Stelbophyllum, commonly known as the silverleaf fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Stelbophyllum species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a fluffy or cotton-like appearance.
